title: What songs did the Beatles write for other artists? - Quora

response.answer_text: Paul lived with Jane Asher for many years over at her parent's house. Peter Asher, Jane Brother, ask Paul McCartney for a Song that was abandon called “World Without Love" because John had laugh at a line “lock me away". So Paul wrote 4 Songs for Peter & Gordon, “World Without Love", “I Don't Want To See You Again", “Nobody I Know" (Lennon-McCartney) & “Woman" written by Bernard Webb a Pseudonym for Paul McCartney. Also, Paul wrote “Goodbye" for Mary Hopkins (Lennon-McCartney), “Come and Get It" for Badfinger (Lennon-McCartney), “Cat Call" for The Chris Barber Band ( Paul McCartney), “Tip Of Tongue" for Tommy Quickly (Lennon-McCartney), “I'll Keep You Satisfied" & “From a Window" for Billy Kramer with the Dakotas (Lennon-McCartney) , “I'll Be On My Way" for Billy Kramer with the Dakotas (McCartney-Lennon), “One & One is Two" for The Strangers with Mike Shannon (Lennon -McCartney), “Like Dreamers Do" For The Applejacks (Lennon-McCartney), “It's For You" & “Step Inside Love" & “Love of the Loved" for Cilla Black (Lennon-McCartney), “That Means A Lot" for P.I Proby (Lennon-McCartney) & “Penina" for Carlos Mendes (Paul McCartney). John Lennon wrote “I'm in Love" for The Fourmost (Lennon-McCartney), “Hello Little Girl" for The FourMost (Lennon-McCartney), & “I Call Your Name" for Billy Kramer with the Dakotas written mainly by John Lennon but with a little help from Paul (Lennon- McCartney). “I Want To Your Man" , A Song Sung by Ringo & The Rolling Stones by written by Both John Lennon & Paul McCartney (Lennon-McCartney), “Bad To Me" for Billy Kramer with the Dakotas was written by Both John Lennon & Paul McCartney (Lennon -McCartney).

Off the top of my head I can think of 3 Beatles songs that were recorded by other artists which became No.1 hits in the UK in the 1960s. They are:- Michelle by The Overlanders in 1966 Ob La Di Ob La Da by The Marmalade in 1967 With a Little Help from my Friends by Joe Cocker in 1968 (probably most well known cover of a Beatles song) The Beatles obviously recorded all these songs themselves so I don't think it could be said that they were written “for" other artists. Perhaps it was just the case of the record companies of these artists seeking permission for them to record their songs and have them released as singles.
